summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the State of Delaware Division of Corporations on August 9, 2019. It commands the production of all records relating to the corporate entity L.S.J, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The subpoena includes a rider specifying the requested records and a declaration of custodian of records form.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York in connection with a criminal investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the State of Delaware Division of Corporations to appear before the Grand Jury to testify and produce records, with the appearance date set for September 6, 2019, at 10:00 a.m.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued and dated by the U.S. Attorney's Office, initiating a formal demand for corporate records as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
State of Delaware Division of Corporations, 401 Federal Street, Suite #4, Dover, DE 19901
L.S.J, LLC, 6100 Red Hook Quarter Suite B-3, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands 00802
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, Squad C-40, New York, NY 10278
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).

The target of the subpoena is the corporate entity L.S.J, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company with a business address in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, and a possible incorporation date of April 17, 1998.

The U.S. Attorney's Office requested confidentiality, asking the recipient to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's integrity.
The requested records include certificates of incorporation, business addresses, service of process addresses, and identifying information on directors, officers, and owners of L.S.J, LLC.

The subpoena was issued by Geoffrey S. Berman, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, in August 2019, indicating active federal investigation into entities potentially linked to Jeffrey Epstein's network around the time of his death.
